item.title: Temporary traffic lights stuck on red, 19th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Close South, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Flytipping, 19th October
item.description:
There is a lot if flytipping outside number 26 kempt street se184et been there nearly three weeks bags of clothes a babys cot all over thevpavement walkway itsza accident likely to happen could you please have yhis taken away as there a people in wheelchairs who cannot get out of there bungalows i thought the council were going to set up cameras to stop this problem but nothing wexpay rent abd council tax that goes up every year and nothing gets done ruddy disgraceful royal borough of greenwich get yhe cameras up please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kempt Street, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt bin and contents, 19th October
item.description:
A bin on Rotherhithe street (close to doubletree docklands) has been burnt! A resident reported on a local fb group that a group of kids were trying to set something else on fire in the neighbourhood. I woke up to find the bin burnt on my street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter in Alleyway, 19th October
item.description:
Lots of litter, cans etc in Alleyway between Stoke Newington Church Street and Oldfield Road / Painsthorpe Road. Reported earlier this week. Received an e mail on Saturday to say problem had been resolved. This is not the case as the litter is still there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass bottles in the road, 19th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: In Southend Rd Beckenham on the corner of Stumps Hill Lane is an empty site enclosed with c. 2.5m high green wooden hoardings. The panels are leaning over the public footway, appearing to be in danger of falling onto unsuspecting pedestrians, perhaps because fence stakes have broken., 18th October
item.description:
In Southend Rd Beckenham on the corner of Stumps Hill Lane is an empty site enclosed with c. 2.5m high green wooden hoardings. The panels are leaning over the public footway, appearing to be in danger of falling onto unsuspecting pedestrians, perhaps because fence stakes have broken. Please take enforcement action against the land owner to repair the hazardous leaning heavy panels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Health & Safety risk, 18th October
item.description:
I’m not entirely sure this is the right way to report it but this lamppost looks like is about to fall dead on the road. We noticed it today while walking down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horse Guards Avenue, Waterloo, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
